meta.description: Miracle First Class Lounge at Suvarnabhumi Airport (BKK), Concourse C. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Miracle First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Near the entrance to Concourse C, proceed down to the entrance on Level 3.

location.description: Bang Phli, Samut Prakan, Bangkok, Thailand

lounge.description: Relax and unwind in the Miracle First Class Lounge prior to your departure from Bangkok. Enjoy a host of amenities, including a wide range of pre-packaged food and beverage, complimentary alcohol, and fast Wi-Fi.

general: Children 2 years old and under are admitted free with an adult.
regulatory: This lounge is only accessible for passengers departing on international flights.

reviews.content: Small, only good for pre-boarding near C gates if short on time.
A very basic lounge with very limited food and seating. Come here if you’ve only limited time, but try the other lounges if you’re looking for a more wholesome meal.
Tiny lounge. D concourse is much spacious. Limited food and alcohol. Not worth the visit.
Very small lounge. No restroom within the lounge. There were plates all over the tables when I got there. Would be fine if you have access, however it isn’t worth a detour or pay to get in.
Tiny and crowded. You would probably miss it if you weren’t paying attention.
Although it is compact, the food is not bad and the room is kept clean. Just a bit disappointing from a personal perspective that this was the only lounge I had access to.
Very small, no own restrooms..chairs need to be replaced.
Not baby friendly. We were asked to stop our seven-month-old twins laughing or leave. Some of the customers were smiling at them. They baby girls were not even crying.
Was an oasis and a wonderful exhale to making stressful traveling smooth. Champagne, good food, good clientele, fast WiFi. Do it.
Really small. At least they've got hot food and decent choice of beverage. Better off to walk to Miracle business or first class in concourse D.
Lacking space and choice of food.
The lounge is small but quite good. Modern with good selection of quality food. Shame about the dirty tables and screaming children. Annoyingly the wifi login has more security than the Pentagon.

This lounge is so basic. No difference with just waiting at the gate: small, uncomfortable, poor selection of foods. It doesn't even have a toilet. The kind that makes you rethink having Priority Pass.
One of the not so better lounges I have been to. Walked in as I didn't want to walk too much from my C gate. But I can see there are much better options in the airport. Food is quite limited.
Very bare lounge with very limited choices of food and drinks. Quality of food is quure poor. Small lounge with not many seats. Over half the seats are plastic.
This lounge has recently been renovated so is much better than before. There's a good selection of drinks but with only small improvements in food, it still doesn't come close to the airline lounges.
Poor. Small. Not much food. But better then public area.
Very small lounge, but there is free slow wifi and drinks. Beats the transit area!
Not the most luxurious lounge since it contains only the bare essentials. Food was simple, but decent and staff was good. WiFi is fine. The downside is that toilets are outside the lounge.
Small size lounge with adequate food and choice of drinks. Service is a bit dull.
This is a small, crowded and noisy lounge that offers good food and drinks.
This is a comfortable lounge with sofas and dim lighting. The garden, food, and WiFi were all great. The workers are a little rude though.
